data.title: Company History｜SHIMANO Corporate Site
data.meta_description: Welcome to the Shimano official corporate website. See our history.
data.text:
1921

Shozaburo Shimano establishes Shimano Iron Works.

In February 1921, he opened Shimano Iron Works in Higashi Minato in Sakai City when he was 26 years old. On the site of a demolished celluloid factory, he rented a nearly 40-square-meter area. The monthly rent was 5 yen. At that time, the new establishment had only a single lathe, measuring about 1.8 meters long. He had borrowed that machine from Sano Iron Works, benefiting from his friendship with its owner.

1922

Begins production of the bicycle freewheel.

By the time he founded his own business, Shozaburo Shimano had already decided to produce freewheels. Of all bicycle components, freewheels entailed the highest level of technology to produce.

1940

The name is changed to Shimano Iron Works Co., Ltd.

In 1940, Shimano Iron Works, Ltd. was founded with Shozaburo Shimano as its first president. The number of employee was about 300.

Shozaburo Shimano becames the first president.

On January 15,1940, the new corporation's first organisational meeting was held. Then Shozaburo Shimano becomes the first president.

1951

The company is renamed Shimano Industrial Co., Ltd.

In February 1951, Shimano Iron Works absorb Shimano Bicycle Company, and the Company's name was changed to Shimano Industrial Company.

1956

Production of external speed changer begins.

1957

Production of internal speed changer (3-speed Hub) begins.

Research on cold forging begins.

Shimano Industrial began research into cold forging in 1957, spurred by an interest in a trade fair exhibit by a West Germany company.

1958

Shozaburo Shimano passes away.

In September 1958, Shozaburo Shimano passed away.

Shozo Shimano becomes the second president.

1961

First time we display the 3-speed hub at the International Show in USA.

We display the 3-speed hub at the International Toy and Cycle Show held in New York City. Bicycle sales in the United States are brisk.

1965

Shimano American Corporation is established in New York.

As the continued existence of Shimano in the USA market seemed to be assured, the company established Shimano American Corporation with office in New York City. Yoshizo Shimano becomes the president.

1970

Shimano Yamaguchi Co., Ltd. (present Shimonoseki Factory) is established in Yamaguchi Prefecture, Japan.

The production system was strengthened by this new factory which would produce coaster brakes at a starting output of 50,000 units per month.

Fishing Tackle Division is launched.

Fishing Tackle Division was launched as a second business pillar which aligns to the corporate vision: contributing to promotion of public health by encouraging outdoor activities.

1971

The DUX series of spinning reels is in the market.

1972

Shimano Europa GmbH. is established in Dusseldorf, West Germany.

Stock is listed on 2nd Section of the Osaka Securities Exchange.

1973

Shimano Racing Team is launched.

In addition to sponsoring actively to cycling team in Europe, Shimano set up own domestic cycling team, Shimano racing Team, in Japan.

Shimano (Singapore) Pte. Ltd. is established.

It was established as the first oversea factory located in Jurong Industrial Estate in Singapore.

Stock listing rises to the 2nd Securities Exchange of Tokyo.

Stock listing rises to the 1st Section of both Tokyo and Osaka Securities Exchanges.

DURA-ACE series of road racing components are released.

1974

Positron is in the market.

It is equipped with the Positron system which has indexed shifting mechanism.

1976

The DURA-ACE 10 series are in the market.

1978

Bantam series of reels are released in the USA.

An ultra-lightweight precision reel targeted at American bass fishermen was introduced to the American market at the AFTMA show.

DURA-ACE EX 7200 is in the market.

1979

Shimano American Corporation is relocated to New Jersey.

1980

DURA-ACE AX 7300 is released.

Shimano introduces DURA-ACE AX 7300 which is aiming for reducing the aerodynamic drag at IFMA show at Koln in W.Germany.

1981-1990

1981

Kumamoto Fishing Tackle is established.

The stock of Dunphy Holding Pty. Ltd. is acquired.

1982

The first SHIMANO 105 series is in the market.

The first Deore XT is in the market.

1983

Shimano Canada Ltd. is established.

BB-X is in the market.

SHIMANO 600EX is in the market.

1984

The first Shimano Greenpia Road (present Shimano Suzuka Road Race) is held.

Shimano initiates Shimano Greenpia Road which is the event for offering enjoyment and fun for sport cycle in order to popularize the sport cycle in Japan.

Shimano Japan Cup is held.

Shimano initiates Shimano Japan Cup which is fishing competition for offering enjoyment and fun for fishing.

DURA-ACE 7400 series with Shimano Index System (SIS) is released.

A remarkable function of DURA-ACE 7400 is Shimano Index System (SIS) that enable secure positioning of the speed change gear by a single action.

1985

Shimano Europe is relocated to Hilden, West Germany.

The Titanos series of new alloy reels are in the market.

Titanos utilizes an advances composite construction which combined titanium fiber, carbon fiber, and resin materials.

1986

Shimano American Corporation merge with Shimano Sales Corporation and move to Irvine, California from New Jersey.

New Deore XT series are in the market.

The New Deore XT components with SIS for mountain bikes are introduced four years after the original Deore XT group.

Sante series are in the market.

The basic concept of developing Sante is to seek beauty of components design. In other words, Sante is designed to attract a wide variety of potential user, rather than a handful of professional racers.

SHIMANO 105 series with SLR are in the market.

New Shimano 105 series is introduced with Shimano Linear Response (SLR) brake system which is to give the cyclist more control over the caliper brakes.

1987

SHIMANO 600 Ultegra series are in the market.

This series incorporates all of DURA-ACE group, including 7-speed SIS.

1988

Andy Hampsten (Seven-Eleven Team) wins the Giro d'Italia with DURA-ACE.

Shimano U.K. Ltd. is established, starts sales of fishing tackle in Europe.

The FROM which is rod order system for deep bodied crucian carp fishing is in the market.

Fine Carbon α Tokei and Fine Carbon α Ayu Zoom rods are released.

The unique feature of the Zoom rod is its adjustable length which allows it to be used for different types of fishing as local conditions demand.

Racing Shoes SH-R100 are in the market.

1989

Shimano Rinkai Distribution Centre is established.

Shimano Benelux B.V. and Shimano Europe Fishing Holding B.V. are established.

STI (Shimano Total Integration) concept Rapid fire Remote shift lever for offroad bikes is released.

Rapid fire system which is the first STI allows the cyclist to shift gears, operate the brakes, and steer without ever removing the hands from the handlebars.

Nexus is released as a new brand of fishing gear.

Shimano starts Nexus fishing gear to more coordinate with Shimano fishing tackle and clothing for enjoying fishing.

1990

Shimano Components (Malaysia) Sdn. Bhd. is established.

Shimano Italy Fishing S.r.l. is established.

Shimano Pedaling Dynamics (SPD) is in the market.

A line of Shoes and Pedals are called SPD designed to be ideal for both pedaling efficiency and for walking.

DURA-ACE (7400 series) with Dual Control Lever is released.

The dual-control lever incorporates a shifter mechanism into the brake lever, making it possible to change speeds without removing one's hands from handlebars.

1921-1980

1991-2000

1991

Corporate name is changed from Shimano Industrial Co., Ltd. to Shimano Inc.

PT Shimano Batam is established.

The XTR series of mountain bike racing components is in the market.

XTR is the first line of mountain bike components for professional racers.

The first SHIMANO RE-EX CROSS COUNTRY is held.

On the occasion of 70th anniversary, "Closer to Nature, Closer to People" was selected as Shimano's official corporate message.

1992

Keizo Shimano becomes third president.

The cycle center (Bicycle Museum) opens.

With the cooperation of Sakai city where Shimano Inc. is located, it is established on the area next to Daisen Park.

Shimano (Kunshan) Bicycle Components Co., Ltd. is established.

The 1st model of STELLA is launched. Shimano Balance Lock (SBL) is released.

Shimano Australia Pty.Ltd. is established.

1993

DURA-ACE 7410 is in the market.

1995

Yoshizo Shimano becomes fourth president.

The 1995 model of STELLA is in the market.

Equipped with SHIP (Smooth and Hi-Power System) to vastly improve reeling.

1996

DURA-ACE 7700 is in the market.

7700 series are developed after thorough review of the previous derailleur system based on the philosophy of "Stress-Free".

1997

G.Loomis,Inc joins Team Shimano.

Auto D is in the market.

1998

The 1998 model of STELLA is in the market.

3rd model is developed extremely thin body based on a conceptual breakthrough: rather than minimizing the reel parts, the development team sought ways to envelop the parts in the most compact manner.

The Aifie golf shop is opened.

DURA-ACE 25th anniversary model is in the market.

This series is a special DURA-ACE released in commemoration of 25 year since its introduction in to the market.

Shimano HB system for snowboards is in the market.

Flightdeck is in the market.

Installation of an operation switch on the lever bracket enables the rider to control this without releasing his/her hand from the handlebar.

1999

The first Shimano Motegi Road Race is held.

WH-7700, wheelsets for road bikes, are launched.

2000

WH-M959, wheelsets for mountain bikes, are launched.

The Millenium model of STELLA is released.

The Stella Millenium Edition, which was male-to-order, featured Super Slow Oscillation System, designed to increase casting distance. This was also the first model to incorporate a screw handle. The entire body was plated and had "Millenium Edition" engraved by laser.

1981-1990

2001-2010

2001

Yozo Shimano becomes fifth president.

The 2001 model of STELLA is released.

Shimano further developed Super Slow Oscillation System employed in Millenium Edition.The development team also identified the effect of the winding strokes on anglers' feel. Awide varaiety of lineups enable users to select the spool of most suitable diameter for each rod.

Shimano (Shanghai) Bicycle Components Co., Ltd. is established.

Shimano Czech Republic s.r.o. is established.

Shimano France Composants Cycles S.A.S. is established.

2002

Shimano (Taiwan) Co.,Ltd. is established.

2003

Shimano (Kunshan) fishing Tackle Co., Ltd. is established.

Shimano (Tianjin) Bicycle Components Co., Ltd. is established.

2004

STELLA 2004 model is in the market.

A stainless steel one-piece bail was employed to take advantage of thin bails. Other advanced features include titanium coated guard fins and a change in the position of stopper switches.

DURA-ACE 7800 series is in the market.

The DURA-ACE 7800 series components are developed with "For 100% Power Transmission Efficiency" as a catchword. This series consisted of 10-speed rear drive trains, HOLLOTECH Ⅱcranksets, ergonomic dual control levers, and other higher performance components.

2005

"Shimano Nordic Cycle AB", "ShimanoNordic Cycle OY" and "Shimano Nordic Cycle AS" are established in Scandinavian Peninsula.

2006

Shimano (Lianyungang) Industrial Co., Ltd. are established.

ACCU-3D, highly-functional cycling wear, is in the market.

2007

Shimano Latin America Representacao Comerial Ltda is established.

R&P Pawlak Sp. Z o. o. is established.

STELLA 2007 model is in the market.

The new model featured an AR-C spool, designed to increase the casting distance by controlling the spool unwinding resistance. Moreover, this mechanism was effective in rescuing line troubles at the time of casting. To prevent corrosion of the bearings especially by saltwater, the new model also featured Anti-Rust Bearings (S A-RB).

2008

The stock of Innovative Textiles Inc. is acquired.

The stock of DashAmerica inc. (Pearl Izumi) is acquired.

DURA-ACE 7900 series is released.

The 7900 series components were developed under the concept of "Evolution of Perfection". A derailleur comprising these components embedded the shift cable completely. Its crankset consisted of a HOLLOWGRIDE (hollow gear) in addition to a HOLLOWTECH Ⅱ. All other components were also reviewed for optimal design.

2009

Lifestyle Gear Division is launched.

Shimano Rinkai Distribution Center renames Shimano sales Co., Ltd..

Marketing of rowing equipment (stretcher and shoes) are in the market.

Electronic Shifting System DURA-ACE 7970 is in the market.

A new technology called "Digital Integrated Intelligence (or Di2 for short) was introduced into DURA-ACE. The DURA-ACE 7900 series equipped with this electronic shifting system provide racers with a "complete stress-free" function.

2010

XEFO is in the market.

The XTR incorporated Dyna-sys is in the market.

STELLA 2010 model incorporated the X-SHIP is released.

The new model incorporated the X-SHIP gear system, developed to achieve ultimate rotation performance. Taking advantage of Shimano's excellent metal processing technologies, particularly its high-precision machining technology, our production team carefully finished metal case. The result was even smoother rotation of the gears.

Shimano STEPS ,the first components for power-assisted bicycle, is released.

1991-2000

2011-2020

2011

Shimano (Cambodia) Co., Ltd. is established.

Opening of Consulate-General of the Republic of Singapore in Osaka, Japan on the second floor of SIC head office building.

2012

DURA-ACE 9000 series is released.

DURA-ACE 9000 series have been fully re-engineered across every system. Highlights include a robust four-arm cranksets, the new SLR-EV brake system and a new 11-speed drive train.

2013

Shimano (Philippines) Inc. is established.

2014

STELLA 2014 model is released.

MicroModule gear technology to the worm shaft idle gear reduces oscillation vibration. This is an incredible breakthrough in design and delivers an outstanding level smoothness without sacrificing strength or durability.

XTR M9000, M9020 series is released.

XTR Di2 M9050 series is released.

SHIMANO Cycling World is opened in Singapore.

First experiential and interactive world of cycling in Singapore. Named Shimano Cycling World, the 650sqm centre is also its’ world’s first cycling gallery. It is located next to the Singapore Sports Museum in the opened Singapore Sports Hub.

SHIMANO SPORTS CAMERA is released.

"Shimano Menat Spor Etkinlikleri Spor Malzemeleri ve Ekipmanlari Ticaret Limited Sirketi" is established in Turkey.

"Shimano Bisiklet Parca ve Ekipmanlari Satis Servis Ticaret Anonim Sirketi" is established in Turkey.

"Shimano Italy Bicycle Components S.r.l" is established.

2015

"HAGANE" concept is launched.

HAGANE is Shimano’s reel design concept which aims at impressive smoothness and overwhelming strength.

"Shimano Uruguay S.A." is established.

Shimano American Corporation 50th Anniversary.

2016

The DURA-ACE R9100 series (road racing components) equipped with power meter are released.

Shimano Shimonoseki Factory Intelligent Plant (SSF_IP) is completed.

Rinkai Logistics Center (RLC) is completed.

2017

SHIMANO SQUARE opens in GRAND FRONT OSAKA

SHIMANO SQUARE opens in Grand Front Osaka (Kita-ku, Osaka City) with the aim of communicating the attraction of its products along with creating and offering new urban sport lifestyle through cycling and fishing.

2018

XTR M9100 series is released

Pursuing the Specific Demands of Each Mountain Bike Category.

STELLA 2018 model is released

The New Shimano Stella has the smoothest and most efficient drive train Shimano has ever engineered with unprecedented durability. The introduction of the newly engineered Micro Module II with unique gear teeth and surface design delivers amazing smoothness and durability above the already unmatched Shimano HAGANE gear quality.

Shimano Argentina S.A.U. is established in Argentina

2019

SHIMANO EXPERIENCE CENTER opens in Valkenburg, The Netherlands

An experience-based exhibition facility focused on the theme of cycling, fishing, and rowing, and where Shimano’s latest technologies can be touched physically has opened within the “PAR’ COURSE” commercial facility.

Shimano’s first ever Gravel Road Bike Components, SHIMANO GRX is launched

The Components for long gravel rides along unpaved roads. A total of 4 group sets, including 3 grades based on how one rides as well as a Di2 mounted series, is introduced. Includes features especially meant for riding along unpaved roads.

2020

Technology Innovation Center at the headquarters is completed.

SHIMANO IBERIA, S.L. is established.

2001-2010

2021-
